description.short_desc: Actions for working with TreeView objects
description.detailed_desc: RJ Implementation: For each command, the 5th parameter "TextValue" must be given as full path with separator "->". Example: "Parent->Child"

description.short_desc: Action to (almost) blindly activate (double-click) a text node.
description.detailed_desc:
No attempt is made to verify that the node exists prior to the selection. No attempt to verify the node has been properly selected after the selection.
It should be noted that a click requires the full hierarchical path to the node to be selected. Parent child branches are delimited with '->' as in:
Parent->branch->leaf
We have also made it possible to attempt to select the Nth duplicate item with the optional MatchIndex parameter for those trees which we can properly process.

description.short_desc: Case-sensitive text of the node to be clicked
description.detailed_desc: TextValue is the case-sensitive text of the node to be clicked

description.short_desc: Optional index of the Nth duplicate item to match.
description.detailed_desc:
Allows us to match duplicate item N in a list containing duplicate entries. For example, match the 2nd (or specified Nth) item whose text matches the provided text value.
The value of the parameter can have 2 forms:
A numeric value. Ex: "3"
Index prefixed value. Ex: "Index=3"
If the field parameter data does not match one of these two forms then the data is ignored and the default(first match) is used.

description.short_desc: Activate (double-click) the first "MyNode" node on the TreeView object.
Activate (double-click) the 3rd duplicate "MyNode" node on the TreeView object.
Activate (double-click) the 3rd duplicate "MyNode" node on the TreeView object.
Copy the current contents of a tree[branch] to a file.
description.detailed_desc:
The search of the path to the node is expected to be a case-sensitive exact match of each node. Use 'PartialMatchTreeDataToFile' if you wish to specify case-insensitive substring matches for tree nodes.
By default, the files will be stored in the active "Test" directory. If you specify a relative path, the path will be relative to the project directory. The directory for a full or relative path must already exist.

description.short_desc: The name of the file used to store the tree data.
description.detailed_desc: The name of the file used to store the tree data. By default, the files will be stored in the active "Test" directory. If you specify a relative path, the path will be relative to the project directory. The directory for a full or relative path must already exist.

description.short_desc: The full name of the tree branch to capture.
description.detailed_desc:
The full name of the tree branch to capture. If omitted, all branches/nodes are captured.
The search of the path to the node is expected to be a case-sensitive exact match of each node. Use 'PartialMatchTreeDataToFile' if you wish to specify case-insensitive substring matches for tree nodes.

description.short_desc: The character(s) to use in the output file to indent the tree nodes from the parent tree branches.
description.detailed_desc: The character(s) to use in the output file to indent the tree nodes from the parent tree branches. If omitted, a tab character is used.

description.short_desc: Specify a character encoding to be used when saving data to a file. If it is not specified, the system default file encoding will be used. The encoding should be a valid string supported by Java; if it is not valid, the system default file encoding will be used instead.
(Future) Specify a file filter to use to process the text before comparison.
(Future) Specify filter options to use with the file filter.
Capture the complete nodeset of aTreeView to a file.
description.detailed_desc:
Data is stored in [project]\Datapool\Test\aFilename.ext file using tab chars to indent the nodes and branches. Because no Branch was specified, the data for the whole tree is captured.
Note the unused reserved fields for FileFilter and FilterOptions were omitted.

example.usage: T, Browser, aJavaTree, CaptureTreeDataToFile, myDirectory\aFilename.ext, "Parent Bank->Branch Banking and Trust", "_"

description.short_desc: Capture the data contents from 'Parent Bank->Branch Banking and Trust' to a file.
description.detailed_desc:
Data is stored in [project]\myDirectory\aFilename.ext file using "_" chars to indent the nodes and branches. Because a Branch was specified, only nodes from that branch are captured.
Note the unused reserved fields for FileFilter and FilterOptions were omitted.

description.short_desc: Capture the complete nodeset of aTreeView to a file.
description.detailed_desc:
Capture the complete nodeset of aTreeView to a file.
Writing file with "UTF-8" encoding.

description.short_desc: Checks a node's state icon (checkbox) according to its associated text value.
description.detailed_desc:
Initially released with .NET support only.
This command might not function correctly when there are duplicate nodes in the tree. However, we have made it possible to attempt to select the Nth duplicate item with the optional MatchIndex parameter for those trees which we can properly process.

description.short_desc: Case-sensitive text of the node to be checked.
description.detailed_desc: TextValue is the case-sensitive text of the node to be checked.

description.short_desc: Optional index of the Nth duplicate item to match.
description.detailed_desc:
Allows us to match duplicate item N in a list containing duplicate entries. For example, match the 2nd (or specified Nth) item whose text matches the provided text value.
The value of the parameter can have 2 forms:
A numeric value. Ex: "3"
Index prefixed value. Ex: "Index=3"
If the field parameter data does not match one of these two forms then the data is ignored and the default(first match) is used.

description.short_desc: Checks the first "MyNode" node state icon (checkbox) on the TreeView object.
Checks the 3rd duplicate "MyNode" node state icon (checkbox) on the TreeView object.
Checks the 3rd duplicate "MyNode" node state icon (checkbox) on the TreeView object.
Action to collapse a node according to its text value.
description.detailed_desc: We have also made it possible to attempt to select the Nth duplicate item with the optional MatchIndex parameter for those trees which we can properly process.

description.short_desc: Case-sensitive text of node to collapse
description.detailed_desc: TextValue is the case-sensitive text of the node to collapse. Parent-Child relationships are separated by "->"

description.short_desc: Optional index of the Nth duplicate item to match.
description.detailed_desc:
Allows us to match duplicate item N in a list containing duplicate entries. For example, match the 2nd (or specified Nth) item whose text matches the provided text value.
The value of the parameter can have 2 forms:
A numeric value. Ex: "3"
Index prefixed value. Ex: "Index=3"
If the field parameter data does not match one of these two forms then the data is ignored and the default(first match) is used.

description.short_desc: Collapses the first "Parent" node.
Collapses the 3rd duplicate "Parent" node.
Collapses the 3rd duplicate "Parent" node.
This action collapses the "Child" node found under "Parent".
Collapses the 3rd duplicate "Child" node found under "Parent".
Action to collapse a node according to a partial match of its text value.
description.detailed_desc:
Partial matching is accomplished through case-insensitive substring matching. Each delimited node of the provided TextValue is compared against the object data using this partial match comparison.
We have also made it possible to attempt to select the Nth duplicate item with the optional MatchIndex parameter for those trees which we can properly process. Only the final node provided in the TextValue hierarchy is evaluated for duplicity. Intermediate nodes are always found on a "first match" basis.

description.short_desc: Case-Insensitive text of node to collapse
description.detailed_desc: TextValue is the case-insensitive text of the node to collapse. Parent-Child relationships are separated by "->" For each level, a text comparison is performed. If the node contains the requested substring anywhere in its text, then that node is considered a match.

description.short_desc: Optional index of the Nth duplicate item to match.
description.detailed_desc:
Allows us to match duplicate item N in a list containing duplicate entries. For example, match the 2nd (or specified Nth) item whose text matches the provided text value.
The value of the parameter can have 2 forms:
A numeric value. Ex: "3"
Index prefixed value. Ex: "Index=3"
If the field parameter data does not match one of these two forms then the data is ignored and the default(first match) is used.

description.short_desc: Collapse the first node with the substring "parent"--ignoring text case.
Collapse the 3rd node with the substring "parent"--ignoring text case.
Collapse the 3rd node with the substring "parent"--ignoring text case.
Collapse the 1st child node containing substring "child" under a parent node containing substring "parent".
Collapse the 3rd child node containing substring "child" under a parent node containing substring "parent".
Action to collapse a node according to a partial match of its text value.
Case-Insensitive text of node to collapse
description.detailed_desc: TextValue is the case-insensitive text of the node to collapse. Parent-Child relationships are separated by "->" For each level, a text comparison is performed. If the node contains the requested substring anywhere in its text, then that node is considered a match.

description.short_desc: This action collapses the "Parent" node.
This action collapses the "Child" node found under "Parent".
Action to collapse a node according to its text value. Use Collapse instead.
description.detailed_desc:
This command might not function correctly when there are duplicate nodes in the tree. However, we have made it possible to attempt to select the Nth duplicate item with the optional MatchIndex parameter for those trees which we can properly process.
RJ Implementation: Works the same as command Collapse.

description.short_desc: Case-sensitive text of node to collapse
description.detailed_desc:
TextValue is the case-sensitive text of the node to collapse
RJ Implementation:TextValue must be given as full path with separator "->". Example: "Parent->Child"

description.short_desc: Optional index of the Nth duplicate item to match.
description.detailed_desc:
Allows us to match duplicate item N in a list containing duplicate entries. For example, match the 2nd (or specified Nth) item whose text matches the provided text value.
The value of the parameter can have 2 forms:
A numeric value. Ex: "3"
Index prefixed value. Ex: "Index=3"
If the field parameter data does not match one of these two forms then the data is ignored and the default(first match) is used.

description.short_desc: Collapses the first "MyNode" node.
Collapses the 3rd duplicate "MyNode" node.
Collapses the 3rd duplicate "MyNode" node.
Action to blindly collapse a node according to its text value.
description.detailed_desc: Generally, no pre- or post- node checks are done. If the tree contains hidden root nodes the user must provide these.

note.value: Implementation verifies the existence of the node, does NOT verify if it is collapsed.

description.short_desc: Case-sensitive full path text of node to collapse
description.detailed_desc: TextValue is the case-sensitive text of the node to collapse. Parent-Child relationships are separated by "->" If the tree contains hidden root nodes they must be provided.

description.short_desc: This action blindly collapses the "Parent" node.
description.detailed_desc: The hidden root node 'root' is provided as required.

description.short_desc: This action collapses the "Child" node found under "Parent".
description.detailed_desc: The hidden root node 'root' is provided as required.

description.short_desc: Action to click a node according to its text value.
description.detailed_desc: We have also made it possible to attempt to select the Nth duplicate item with the optional MatchIndex parameter for those trees which we can properly process.

description.short_desc: Clicks the first "Parent" node.
Clicks the 3rd "Parent" node.
Clicks the 3rd "Parent" node.
Clicks the first "Child" node found under first "Parent" node.
Clicks the 3rd "Child" node found under first "Parent" node.

description.detailed_desc: TextValue is the case-sensitive text of the node to be clicked

description.short_desc: Optional index of the Nth duplicate item to match.
description.detailed_desc:
Allows us to match duplicate item N in a list containing duplicate entries. For example, match the 2nd (or specified Nth) item whose text matches the provided text value.
The value of the parameter can have 2 forms:
A numeric value. Ex: "3"
Index prefixed value. Ex: "Index=3"
If the field parameter data does not match one of these two forms then the data is ignored and the default(first match) is used.

description.short_desc: Single right-click the first "MyNode" node on the TreeView object.
Single right-click the 3rd duplicate "MyNode" node on the TreeView object.
Single right-click the 3rd duplicate "MyNode" node on the TreeView object.
Action to (almost) blindly right-click a text node.
description.detailed_desc:
No attempt is made to verify that the node exists prior to the selection. No attempt to verify the node has been properly selected after the selection.
It should be noted that a click requires the full hierarchical path to the node to be selected. Parent child branches are delimited with '->' as in:
Parent->branch->leaf
We have also made it possible to attempt to select the Nth duplicate item with the optional MatchIndex parameter for those trees which we can properly process.

note.value: Implementation verifies the existence of the node, does NOT verify if it is selected.

description.short_desc: Case-sensitive text of the node to be clicked
description.detailed_desc: TextValue is the case-sensitive text of the node to be clicked

description.short_desc: Optional index of the Nth duplicate item to match.
description.detailed_desc:
Allows us to match duplicate item N in a list containing duplicate entries. For example, match the 2nd (or specified Nth) item whose text matches the provided text value.
The value of the parameter can have 2 forms:
A numeric value. Ex: "3"
Index prefixed value. Ex: "Index=3"
If the field parameter data does not match one of these two forms then the data is ignored and the default(first match) is used.

description.short_desc: Single Right-Click the first "MyNode" node on the TreeView object.
Single Right-Click the 3rd duplicate "MyNode" node on the TreeView object.
Single Right-Click the 3rd duplicate "MyNode" node on the TreeView object.
Action to select a node according to its text value.
description.detailed_desc:
We have also made it possible to attempt to select the Nth duplicate item with the optional MatchIndex parameter for those trees which we can properly process.
RJ Implementation: Works the same as command Click.

description.short_desc: Case-sensitive text of node to select.
description.detailed_desc: TextValue is the case-sensitive text of the node to select. Parent-Child relationships are separated by "->"

description.short_desc: Optional index of the Nth duplicate item to match.
description.detailed_desc:
Allows us to match duplicate item N in a list containing duplicate entries. For example, match the 2nd (or specified Nth) item whose text matches the provided text value.
The value of the parameter can have 2 forms:
A numeric value. Ex: "3"
Index prefixed value. Ex: "Index=3"
If the field parameter data does not match one of these two forms then the data is ignored and the default(first match) is used.

description.short_desc: Selects the 1st "Parent" node.
Selects the 3rd duplicate "Parent" node.
Selects the 3rd duplicate "Parent" node.
Selects the first "Child" node found under "Parent".
Selects the 3rd duplicate "Child" node found under "Parent".
Action to select a node according to a partial match of its text value, in addition to any nodes already selected. Performs selection as if CTRL key were held down during selection.
Case-Insensitive text of node to select.
description.detailed_desc: TextValue is the case-insensitive text of the node to select. Parent-Child relationships are separated by "->" For each level, a text comparison is performed. If the node contains the requested substring anywhere in its text, then that node is considered a match.

description.short_desc: This action selects the "My New Parent" node.
This action selects the "My Stepchild" node found under "My New Parent".
Action to select a node according to its text value, in addition to any nodes already selected.
Case-sensitive text of node to select.
description.detailed_desc: TextValue is the case-sensitive text of the node to select. Parent-Child relationships are separated by "->"

description.short_desc: This action selects the "Parent" node.
This action selects the "Child" node found under "Parent".
Action to blindly select a node according to its text value, in addition to any nodes already selected.
description.detailed_desc: Generally, no pre- or post- node checks are done. If the tree contains hidden root nodes the user must provide these.

description.short_desc: Case-sensitive full path text of node to select.
description.detailed_desc: TextValue is the case-sensitive text of the node to select. Parent-Child relationships are separated by "->" If the tree contains hidden root nodes they must be provided.

description.short_desc: This action blindly selects the "Parent" node.
description.detailed_desc: The hidden root node is provided as required.

description.short_desc: This action blindly selects the "Child" node found under "Parent".
description.detailed_desc: The hidden root node is provided as required.

description.short_desc: Action to select a node according to a partial match of its text value.
description.detailed_desc:
Partial matching is accomplished through case-insensitive substring matching. Each delimited node of the provided TextValue is compared against the object data using this partial match comparison.
We have also made it possible to attempt to select the Nth duplicate item with the optional MatchIndex parameter for those trees which we can properly process. Only the final node provided in the TextValue hierarchy is evaluated for duplicity. Intermediate nodes are always found on a "first match" basis.

description.short_desc: Case-Insensitive text of node to select.
description.detailed_desc: TextValue is the case-insensitive text of the node to select. Parent-Child relationships are separated by "->" For each level, a text comparison is performed. If the node contains the requested substring anywhere in its text, then that node is considered a match.

description.short_desc: Optional index of the Nth duplicate item to match.
description.detailed_desc:
Allows us to match duplicate item N in a list containing duplicate entries. For example, match the 2nd (or specified Nth) item whose text matches the provided text value.
The value of the parameter can have 2 forms:
A numeric value. Ex: "3"
Index prefixed value. Ex: "Index=3"
If the field parameter data does not match one of these two forms then the data is ignored and the default(first match) is used.

description.short_desc: Select the first node with the substring "parent"--ignoring text case.
Select the 3rd node with the substring "parent"--ignoring text case.
Select the 3rd node with the substring "parent"--ignoring text case.
Select the 1st child node containing substring "child" under a parent node containing substring "parent".
Select the 3rd child node containing substring "child" under a parent node containing substring "parent".
Action to select a node according to a partial match of its text value. Performs selection as if CTRL key were held down during selection.
Case-Insensitive text of node to select.
description.detailed_desc: TextValue is the case-insensitive text of the node to select. Parent-Child relationships are separated by "->" For each level, a text comparison is performed. If the node contains the requested substring anywhere in its text, then that node is considered a match.

description.short_desc: This action selects the "My New Parent" node.
This action selects the "My Stepchild" node found under "My New Parent".
Select/check a node's state icon (checkbox) according to its associated text value.
description.detailed_desc: This command might not function correctly when there are duplicate nodes in the tree. However, we have made it possible to attempt to select the Nth duplicate item with the optional MatchIndex parameter for those trees which we can properly process.

description.short_desc: Case-sensitive text of the node to be selected/checked.
description.detailed_desc: TextValue is the case-sensitive text of the node to be selected/checked.

The value of the parameter can have 2 forms:
A numeric value. Ex: "3"
Index prefixed value. Ex: "Index=3"
If the field parameter data does not match one of these two forms then the data is ignored and the default(first match) is used.

description.short_desc: Selects/checks the first "MyNode" node state icon (checkbox) on the TreeView object.
Selects/Checks the 3rd duplicate "MyNode" node state icon (checkbox) on the TreeView object.

Sets a user-defined variable with the result of whether a tree contains the provided node.

detailed_desc.p: The search of the path to the node is expected to be a case-sensitive exact match of each node. Use 'SetTreeContainsPartialMatch' if you wish to specify case-insensitive substring matches for tree nodes.

description.short_desc: The name of the node to verify.
description.detailed_desc:
The search of the path to the node is expected to be a case-sensitive exact match of each node. Use 'SetTreeContainsPartialMatch' if you wish to specify case-insensitive substring matches for tree nodes.
RJ Implementation:TextValue must be given as full path with separator "->". Example: "Parent->Child"

description.short_desc: The name of the variable which gets assigned the result.
description.detailed_desc: The value of 'TRUE' indicates the node was found in the tree, and 'FALSE' indicates that the node was not found in the tree.

example.usage: T, Browser, aTreeView, SetTreeContainsNode, "Parent Bank->Branch Banking and Trust", isFound

description.short_desc: Variable isFound will be set to 'TRUE' if the node 'Parent Bank->Branch Banking and Trust' is found in aTreeView. If not found, isFound will be set to 'FALSE'.
Sets a user-defined variable with the result of whether a tree contains the provided node according to a partial match of the node's text value.

detailed_desc.p: The search of the path to the node is expected to be a case-insensitive substring match of each node. Use 'SetTreeContainsNode' if you wish to specify case-sensitive substring matches for tree nodes.

description.short_desc: The name of the node to verify.
description.detailed_desc:
The search of the path to the node is expected to be a case-insensitive substring match of each node. Use 'SetTreeContainsNode' if you wish to specify case-sensitive substring matches for tree nodes.
RJ Implementation:TextValue must be given as full path with separator "->". Example: "Parent->Child"

description.short_desc: The name of the variable which gets assigned the result.
description.detailed_desc: The value of 'TRUE' indicates the node was found in the tree, and 'FALSE' indicates that the node was not found in the tree.

description.short_desc: Variable isFound will be set to 'TRUE' if a child node of 'parent' containing 'branch' is found in aTreeView. If not found, isFound will be set to 'FALSE'.
description.detailed_desc: Thus, this could be a match for 'Parent Bank->Branch Banking and Trust'.

description.short_desc: Action to blindly SHIFT-click a node according to its text value. Currently, this component function is for JavaTrees only.
Case-sensitive text of node to SHIFT-click.

Verify that a tree contains the provided node.

detailed_desc.p: The search of the path to the node is expected to be a case-sensitive exact match of each node. Use 'VerifyTreeContainsPartialMatch' if you wish to specify case-insensitive substring matches for tree nodes.

description.short_desc: The name of the node to verify.
description.detailed_desc: The search of the path to the node is expected to be a case-sensitive exact match of each node. Use 'VerifyTreeContainsPartialMatch' if you wish to specify case-insensitive substring matches for tree nodes.

example.usage: T, Browser, aTreeView, VerifyTreeContainsNode, "Parent Bank->Branch Banking and Trust"

description.short_desc: Verify the node 'Parent Bank->Branch Banking and Trust' is found in aTreeView.
Verify that a tree contains the provided node according to a partial match of the node's text value.

detailed_desc.p: The search of the path to the node is expected to be a case-insensitive substring match of each node. Use 'VerifyTreeContainsNode' if you wish to specify case-sensitive substring matches for tree nodes.

description.short_desc: Holds down either Ctrl or Shift while making an item selection with emulating either a Left or Right mouse click.

detailed_desc.p: This keyword can be used to select multiple items.

description.short_desc: Case-sensitive text of node to select.
description.detailed_desc: TextValue is the case-sensitive text of the node to select.

description.short_desc: Optional index of the Nth duplicate item to match.
description.detailed_desc:
Allows us to match duplicate item N in a list containing duplicate entries. For example, match the 2nd (or specified Nth) item whose text matches the provided text value.
The value of the parameter can have 2 forms:
A numeric value. Ex: "3"
Index prefixed value. Ex: "Index=3"
If the field parameter data does not match one of these two forms then the data is ignored and the default(first match) is used.

description.short_desc: The special key command used in the row selection. For now, only Control and Shift are supported.
The type of mouse click needed. For now, only Left and Right are supported.

example.usage: T, WINDOW, ATreeView, SelectTextNodeSpecial, "Parent", , Shift, Left

description.short_desc: Make mouse-left-click on the first node with the text "Parent" exactly matched, in the same time the key 'Shift' is pressed down.

example.usage: T, WINDOW, ATreeView, SelectTextNodeSpecial, "Parent", , Control, Left

description.short_desc: Make mouse-left-click on the first node with the text "Parent" exactly matched, in the same time the key 'Ctrl' is pressed down.
Holds down either Ctrl or Shift while making an item selection with emulating either a Left or Right mouse click. The Selection is made according to a partial match of its text value.

detailed_desc.p: This keyword can be used to select multiple items.

description.short_desc: Case-Insensitive text (can be a part of whole text) of node to select.
description.detailed_desc: TextValue is the case-insensitive text (can be a part of whole text) of the node to select.

description.short_desc: Optional index of the Nth duplicate item to match.
description.detailed_desc:
Allows us to match duplicate item N in a list containing duplicate entries. For example, match the 2nd (or specified Nth) item whose text matches the provided text value.
The value of the parameter can have 2 forms:
A numeric value. Ex: "3"
Index prefixed value. Ex: "Index=3"
If the field parameter data does not match one of these two forms then the data is ignored and the default(first match) is used.

description.short_desc: The special key command used in the row selection. For now, only Control and Shift are supported.
The type of mouse click needed. For now, only Left and Right are supported.

example.usage: T, WINDOW, ATreeView, SelectPartialTextNodeSpecial, "parent", , Shift, Left

description.short_desc: Make mouse-left-click on the first node with the substring "parent"--ignoring text case, in the same time the key 'Shift' is pressed down.

example.usage: T, WINDOW, ATreeView, SelectPartialTextNodeSpecial, "parent", , Control, Left

description.short_desc: Make mouse-left-click on the first node with the substring "parent"--ignoring text case, in the same time the key 'Ctrl' is pressed down.
